question:
The Credit Linked Capital Subsidy Scheme (CLCSS) aims to allow access capital for:
  1. Micro Enterprises
  2. Small Enterprises
  3. Medium Enterprises
Select the correct option from codes given below:
explanation: The latest update to the Credit linked Capital Subsidy Scheme (CLCSS) to allow micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) access to capital was done in September, 2019.The scheme provides an upfront subsidy of 15 per cent on institutional credit up to Rs 1 crore for MSMEs in the specified 51 sub-sectors. There is an additional 10 per cent subsidy for SC-ST entrepreneurs while special provisions have been made for 117 'aspirational' districts, hill states and the northeastern region.
